summary: "Fargo" is a 1996 dark comedy crime movie by the Coen brothers. It stars Frances McDormand as a pregnant police chief investigating a triple murder. The crime was ordered by a car salesman who wanted to kidnap his wife for money. The film was a hit and won several awards, including two Oscars. It's considered one of the best American films and was preserved in the U.S. National Film Registry. A popular TV series based on the movie came out in 2014.
title: Fargo (1996 film)
